I have over 15 calculators installed in my phone and tablet. As a Math teacher, I'm always eager to see which one is the best. I love Panecal because of its extended display and user friendliness. I wish it showed some more advanced features (graphics, matrix/vectors, polynomial/equation solving, et...Full ReviewI have over 15 calculators installed in my phone and tablet. As a Math teacher, I'm always eager to see which one is the best. I love Panecal because of its extended display and user friendliness. I wish it showed some more advanced features (graphics, matrix/vectors, polynomial/equation solving, etc) but for overall scientific/general use IT'S THE BEST HANDS DOWN.

Easy to edit equations Unlike many other calculators, this makes it easy to copy and edit equations. Long equations are supported and wrap. It would be nice if there was a live preview mode. Also there are many advanced math features that are missing, but it is good and simple for the basics.

Long press for yellow items absent To activate yellow items, we have to press ALT key first and then press the relevant key. It would be so great if they get activated simply by a long press just like other calculators.

One more feature to make perfect Assume I have a function say f(x)=cosx+sinx and want to calculate f(1), I would have to input cos1+sin1 first, and then if I want to calculate f(2), I need to use the replay function and replace 1 with 2, this is very inconvenient, so my suggestion is to allow people input cosy+ siny first,(default ...Full ReviewAssume I have a function say f(x)=cosx+sinx and want to calculate f(1), I would have to input cos1+sin1 first, and then if I want to calculate f(2), I need to use the replay function and replace 1 with 2, this is very inconvenient, so my suggestion is to allow people input cosy+ siny first,(default value of y is 0), after calculation,we got f(0), if I want to calculate f(2), I just need to assign 2 to y, and replay the function, this makes calculation much faster

Great Calc App! This app works GREAT! For those that say the square key (x^2) is wrong are mistaken. To square a negative number you must use parentheses (). Ex: (-6)^2 = 36, but -6^2= -36. It works exactly as it should, nice work!

Correction to previous reviews First off, this is a good app. To the previous reviewers, '-4^2=-16' is a mathematically correct statement, as power has precedence over multiplication. You need to do (-4)^2 to get what you want to do. IMO this is the proper way to do things.
Error This calculator does not convert negative sign to positive when using the square key (X^2). Any number multiplied to the square should be positive at all times regardles of sign.
